p: Inhibitory actions of aspirin or other non-steroidal anti-inflammatory drugs against COX-1 may present crucial problems in pharmacotherapy. Some anti-inflammatory drugs that act only to inhibit COX-1 are ibuprofen, naproxen, fenoprofen, ketoprofen, flurbiprofen, and oxaprozin (derivatives of propionic acid); indomethacin, sulindac, and etodolac (indoleacetic acids); piroxicam (derived from oxyanas); mefenamic acid and meclofenamate (phanamates); and diclofenac [ 29].
